definitions: A shaft sunk into the ground to obtain water, oil, or gas.
A place where there are mineral springs.
A depression made to hold liquid.
An enclosed space in the middle of a building, giving room for stairs or a lift, or to allow light or ventilation.
The place in a law court where the clerks and ushers sit.
A shelf beneath the counter of a bar on which bottles of alcohol are stored within easy reach of the person serving.
Denoting or made with the relatively inexpensive brands of alcohol stored in the well of a bar.
